src: "Kei a tātou ināianei ngā kiore e 4-marama te pakeke kāore i te pāngia e te mate huka, ahakoa i mua i pāngia e te mate huka," tana kōrero tāpiri.
mt: 4-month-old mice are not immune to death by heart attack, despite previous immunity to heart attack," he said.
ref: "We now have 4-month-old mice that are non-diabetic that used to be diabetic," he added.

src: Ko ngā whakatūpato a Tākuta Ehud Ur, Ahorangi mō te Rongoā ki Te Whare Wānanga o Dalhousie, kei Halifax, Nova Scotia, ko te heamana hoki mō ngā mahi whakamātau rongoā, pūtaiao hoki ki te Canadian Diabetes Association, kei te mata tonu ngā mahi rangahau.
mt: Professor Ehud Ur, Dalhousie University's dean of medicine, Halifax, Nova Scotia, and president of the Canadian Diabetes Association, is continuing his research.
ref: Dr. Ehud Ur, professor of medicine at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia and chair of the clinical and scientific division of the Canadian Diabetes Association cautioned that the research is still in its early days.

src: Pēnei i ētahi atu tōhunga, kei te ruarua kē ōna mahara e pā ana ki te whakaora i te mate huka, me te mōhio iho kāore ēnei kōrero e hāngai ana ki te hunga kua pāngia kētia ki te mate huka momo 1.
mt: Like other experts, he is skeptical of claims to cure AIDS, and is aware that these claims do not apply to people who have already contracted type 1 AIDS.
ref: Like some other experts, he is skeptical about whether diabetes can be cured, noting that these findings have no relevance to people who already have Type 1 diabetes.

src: I te Mane, i whakapuaki tūmatanuitia e ara Danius, te hekeretari ū o te Nobel Committee for Literature ki te Swedish Academy, i tētahi hōtaka reo irirangi ki Sveriges Radio ki Huitene ko te komiti, kāore i te āhei ki te whakapā tōtika atu ki a Bob Dylan mō tāna toa i te 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, kua whakarere i āna mahi ki te pā atu ki a ia.
mt: On Monday, the Swedish Academy's permanent secretary, Sara Danius, announced on a radio show that the committee had been unable to reach Bob Dylan to inform him of his 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, which had been awarded to him.
ref: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him.

src: Nā Danius i kī, "Ināiatonunei kāore mātou i te paku aha. Kua waea atu au, kua tuku īmēra anō hoki ki tōna hoa mahi ngātahi tata rawa, ā, kua tae mai he whakahoki tino hoahoa. Mō tēnei wā, kua nui tērā."
mt: Danius said, "I don't think we're going to make it. I've called, and sent a message to his co-worker, and he's responded. For now, it's pretty bad."
ref: Danius said, "Right now we are doing nothing. I have called and sent emails to his closest collaborator and received very friendly replies. For now, that is certainly enough."

src: I mua atu, nā te CEO o Ring, nā Jamie Siminoff i kī, i tīmata te kamupene i te wā kāore tāna pere kuaha i te rangona mai i tana toa ki tōna karāti.
mt: Previously, Ring CEO Jamie Siminoff said the company started with no money and no way to get noticed for its invention.
ref: Previously, Ring's CEO, Jamie Siminoff, remarked the company started when his doorbell wasn't audible from his shop in his garage.

src: I hangaia mai e ia he pere kuaha ahokore.
mt: He was a former police officer.
ref: He built a WiFi door bell, he said.

src: I kī a Siminoff i piki ake ngā hokonga whai muri i tana putanga i te hōtaka Shark Tank i te tau 2013 i te wā kāore te paewhiri o te hōtaka i whakaae kia hoatu moni mō te timatanga o te pākihi.
mt: 2013, Siminoff's sales increased after his appearance on the Shark Tank show, when the show's investors refused to fund the start-up.
ref: Siminoff said sales boosted after his 2013 appearance in a Shark Tank episode where the show panel declined funding the startup.

src: I te mutunga o te tau 2017, i kitea a Siminoff ki te hongere pouaka whakaata hoko, ki QVC.
mt: 2017, Siminoff was seen on QVC selling a television stand.
ref: In late 2017, Siminoff appeared on shopping television channel QVC.

src: I whakatau hoki a Ring i tētahi take ture ki te kamupene whakahaumaru tātāwhāinga, ko te ADT Corporation.
mt: Ring also sued the safety equipment company, ADT Corporation.
ref: Ring also settled a lawsuit with competing security company, the ADT Corporation.

src: Ahakoa ko te āhua o tētahi rongoā āraimate e whakamātautauhia ana he āwhina pea i te mate mai i te Ebola, tae noa mai ki tēnei wā, karekau he rongoā kua pai te whakaatu kia whakamaimoa i te pokenga kua pā kē.
mt: Although the experimental drug was shown to help fight Ebola, to date, no drug has been proven to be safe enough to be widely used.
ref: While one experimental vaccine appears able to reduce Ebola mortality, up until now, no drugs have been clearly demonstrated suitable for treating existing infection.

src: Kotahi te pāhekoheko paturopi, te ZMapp, i whakaatu tuatahi i ētahi putanga papai i te mātai, heoi nā ngā rangahau ōkawa i whakaatu he iti ake ngā painga i tērā i pīrangitia mō te haukoti i te mate.
mt: 1 of the experimental drugs, ZMapp, was first used in some patients, but research showed it had little effect on the disease.
ref: One antibody cocktail, ZMapp, initially showed promise in the field, but formal studies indicated it had less benefit than sought in preventing death.

src: Ki te whakamātau PALM, ko Zmapp hei pae, arā ka whakamahia e ngā kaipūtaiao hei pūtake, ā, ka whakatairitea ngā maimoatanga hou e toru i tērā.
mt: PALM, Zmapp is a platform, researchers use it as a base, and three new antibodies are added to it.
ref: In the PALM trial, ZMapp served as a control, meaning scientists used it as a baseline and compared the three other treatments to it.

src: Kei te tautoko a USA Gymnastics i te reta a te United States Olympic Committee, ā, kei te whakaae ki te hiahia waiwai o te whānau Olympic hei tuku i tētahi taiao haumaru mō te katoa o ā mātou kaipara.
mt: USA Gymnastics supports the letter from the United States Olympic Committee, and agrees with the Olympic family's desire to create a safe environment for all our athletes.
ref: USA Gymnastics supports the United States Olympic Committee's letter and accepts the absolute need of the Olympic family to promote a safe environment for all of our athletes.

src: Kei te whakaae mātou ki te tauākī a te USOC ko ngā pānga o ā mātou kaioma, karapū hoki, tae atu ki tā rātou momo hākinakina, ka pai ake te tautoko i a rātou mā te koke whakamua ki te panoni whai tikanga ki roto tonu i tō tātou whakahaere, kaua ko te whakakore tiwhikete.
mt: We agree with the USOC that our athletes' and coaches' access to our facilities, equipment, and other resources will be enhanced by the continued use of our facilities in accordance with our normal operations, rather than by the removal of our facilities.
ref: We agree with the USOC's statement that the interests of our athletes and clubs, and their sport, may be better served by moving forward with meaningful change within our organization, rather than decertification.

src: Ka tautoko te takaporepore USA i tētahi tirohanga motuhake e rewa ake ai ngā āhutanga whakamanioro o ngā mahinga i kōrerotia māiangia e ngā mōrehu o Larry Nassar, i āhei pea te haere hara kore mō te wā roa, ā, ahakoa te tīnitanga, me mahi.
mt: The US Justice Department will support a separate review to determine whether the handling of the Larry Nassar case, which could have gone unprosecuted for years, was appropriate, despite the outcome.
ref: USA Gymnastics supports an independent investigation that may shine light on how abuse of the proportion described so courageously by the survivors of Larry Nassar could have gone undetected for so long and embraces any necessary and appropriate changes.

src: He ōrite nei tā USA Gymnastics me tā USOC whāinga - i runga i tēnā kia āta manaakitia te hākinakina takahurihuri kia taea ai e ngā kaiaka te whai i ā rātou whāinga i roto i tētahi taiao manaaki me te tiaki.
mt: USA Gymnastics and USOC have the same goal - to ensure safe sport so athletes can achieve their goals in a safe and healthy environment.
ref: USA Gymnastics and the USOC have the same goal — making the sport of gymnastics, and others, as safe as possible for athletes to follow their dreams in a safe, positive and empowered environment.

src: Mō te roanga o ngā tau 1960, i mahi a Brzezinski mā John F. Kennedy hei kaitohutohu, ā, katahi ko te tari o Lyndon B. Johnson.
mt: 1960s, Brzezinski served as an advisor to John F. Kennedy, and later to Lyndon B. Johnson.
ref: Throughout 1960s, Brzezinski worked for John F. Kennedy as his advisor and then the Lyndon B. Johnson administration.

src: I te wā o ngā kōwhiringa 1976 i tohutohu ia ki a Carter mō ngā kaupapa here ā-ao, ā, kātahi ia ka tū hei National Security Advisor (NSA) mai i te tau 1977 ki te tau 1981, ka whai i a Henare Kissinger.
mt: 1976, Carter appointed him to advise on domestic and foreign policy, and he served as National Security Advisor from 1977 to 1981, succeeding Henry Kissinger.
ref: During the 1976 selections he advised Carter on foreign policy, then served as National Security Advisor (NSA) from 1977 to 1981, succeeding Henry Kissinger.

src: I tōna tūranga ki te NSA, i tautoko ia i a Carter i roto i ngā take huhua o te ao, pērā ki ngā take ki Camp David i te 1978, ngā mahinga ngātahi i waenga i a Amerika me Haina i te pito o ngā tau 1970, ngā uauatanga ki Iran i hua ai te raru nui ki reira i te tau 1979 me te urutomonga o te Soviet ki roto o Afghanistan i te tau 1979.
mt: In his role at the NSA, he supported Carter in a number of world events, such as the Camp David accords in 1978, the joint ventures between the United States and China in the late 1970s, the crisis in Iran that led to the hostage crisis in 1979 and the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan in 1979.
ref: As NSA, he assisted Carter in diplomatically handling world affairs, such as the Camp David Accords, 1978; normalizing US–China relations thought the late 1970s; the Iranian Revolution, which led to the Iran hostage crisis, 1979; and the Soviet invasion in Afghanistan, 1979.

src: Ko te kiriata, e whakaatu ana i a Ryan Gosling me Emma Stone, i tohua ki ngā wāhanga nui katoa.
mt: 2017's La La Land, starring Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone, was nominated for all major awards.
ref: The movie, featuring Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone, received nominations in all major categories.

src: I tohua a Gosling rāua ko Stone hei Best Actor me Best Actress.
mt: Gosling and Stone were nominated for Best Actor and Best Actress.
ref: Gosling and Stone received nominations for Best Actor and Actress respectively.

src: Ko ētahi ingoa kē atu kua whakaurungia ko te Pikitia Pai, te kaihautu, te kiriataata, te Hoahoa Tākahu, te Whakatika Kiriata, te Tohu Tuatahi, te Hanga Hoahoa, te Whakapai Oro, te Whakaranu Oro me te Kiriata Taketakenga.
mt: Other names include the Painter, the driver, the cameraman, the Art Director, the Art Assistant, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department, the Art Department
ref: The other nominations include Best Picture, Director, Cinematography, Costume Design, Film-editing, Original Score, Production Design, Sound Editing, Sound Mixing and Original Screenplay.

src: E rua ngā waiata i te kiriata, Audition (The Fools Who Dream) me City of Stars, i whiwhi whakaaringa mō te waiata tūturu pai rawa. I whiwhi a Lionsgate studio i te 26 whakaaringa - he nui ake i tētahi atu taupuni mahi.
mt: 2 songs from the film, Audition (The Fools Who Dream) and City of Stars, won the best original song award. Lionsgate studio won 26 awards - more than any other studio.
ref: Two songs from the movie, Audition (The Fools Who Dream) and City of Stars, received nominations for best original song. Lionsgate studio received 26 nominations — more than any other studio.

src: I te mutunga o te Rātapu, i roto i tētahi tauāki nā te Perehitene o Amerika nā Donald Trump i te heketeri o ngā perehi, i kī ai ka wehe ngā hōia Amerika i a Syria.
mt: On Sunday, in a speech to the United Nations General Assembly, U.S. President Donald Trump said American troops would leave Syria.
ref: Late on Sunday, the United States President Donald Trump, in a statement delivered via the press secretary, announced US troops would be leaving Syria.

src: I whakapuakina whai muri i te kōrero ā-waea a Trump ki te Perehetini nō Tākei a Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
mt: This came after Trump's phone call with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
ref: The announcement was made after Trump had a phone conversation with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.

src: Ka whai mana hoki a Tākei mō te tiaki i ngā kaiwhawhai ISIS kua mauheretia, arā, e ai ki te puakitanga, kua karo ngā whenua Ūropi ki te whakahoki atu i a rātou.
mt: The U.S. also has a role in protecting ISIS detainees, according to the report, as European countries have begun returning them.
ref: Turkey would also take over guarding captured ISIS fighters which, the statement said, European nations have refused to repatriate.

src: E kī ana tēnei i mau raukura ētahi mokoweri, he ariā e whakaponotia whānuitia ana, engari he kōrero e mau ana ka kore nei e kitea ki runga anga pōhatu, pērā ki te tae, me te tōna hanga ahu tengi nei.
mt: This article contains material that is written like an advertisement. Please help improve it by removing promotional content and inappropriate external links, and by adding encyclopedic content written from a neutral point of view. (September 2010)
ref: This not only confirms that at least some dinosaurs had feathers, a theory already widespread, but provides details fossils generally cannot, such as color and three-dimensional arrangement.

src: e kī nei ngā kaipūtaiao ko ngā huruhuru o tēnei kararehe he parauri o runga, ā, he kōmā, he ārani o raro.
mt: The scientists say the animal's fur is a type of camouflage, and its underbelly is a type of camouflage.
ref: . Scientists say this animal's plumage was chestnut-brown on top with a pale or carotenoid-colored underside.

src: Mā tēnei kitenga e kite ai te māramatanga ki te kukuwhatanga o ngā raukura manu.
mt: This discovery may help unlock the secrets of bird feathers.
ref: The find also grants insight into the evolution of feathers in birds.

src: I te mea kāore ngā huruhuru tainahora i te whanake pai i te tuara, e kī ana ko te rachis, ēngari kāore he āhuatanga kē atu o te huruhuru - ko ngā niwha me ngā barbules - e kī ana ngā kairangahau kāore e kore ko te rachis tētahi mea i kukuwha ake i muri ake i ēnei atu āhuatanga.
mt: Because the feathers of the tail are not well developed, the rachis, but there are no other features of the feather - the barbs and barbules - say researchers are not a thing that has been cut after these features.
ref: Because the dinosaur feathers do not have a well-developed shaft, called a rachis, but do have other features of feathers — barbs and barbules — the researchers inferred the rachis was likely a later evolutionary development that these other features.

src: E ai ki te hanganga o ngā huru kāore i whakamahia kia rere, engari kē mō te whakahaere paemahana, te whakaaturanga rānei. I marohi ngā kairangahau, ahakoa koinei te whiore o tētahi kūao mokonui, kei te kitea ki te tauira ngā huruhuru pakeke, kaua ko ngā huruhuru pīpī.
mt: The invention of the hairbrush is not credited to anyone in particular, but rather to the general process of invention. The researchers, however, note that the hairbrush is an example of a useful invention that is not a biological adaptation.
ref: The feathers' structure suggests that they were not used in flight but rather for temperature regulation or display. The researchers suggested that, even though this is the tail of a young dinosaur, the sample shows adult plumage and not a chick's down.

src: I marohitia e ngā kairangahau, ahakoa koinei te whiore o tētahi mokonui punua, kei te whakaaturia e te tauira ngā huruhuru o te pakeke, kaua ko te pīpī.
mt: Researchers say, although this is the first time a bird has been cloned, the specimen looks like a normal chicken, not a duck.
ref: The researchers suggested that, even though this is the tail of a young dinosaur, the sample shows adult plumage and not a chick's down.

src: I pahū mai tētahi pōmu waka ki te wharenui o ngā pirhimana ki Gaziantep Tākei i te ata o nanahi. Ka mate ngā pirihimana e rua, ka neke atu i te rua tekau anō i whara.
mt: 2 people died and 22 were injured when a bomb exploded at the government building in Gaziantep on Saturday morning.
ref: A car bomb detonated at police headquarters in Gaziantep, Turkey yesterday morning killed two police officers and injured more than twenty other people.

src: I kīia e te tari o te kāwanam he tekau mā iwa o te hunga i whara he pirihimana.
mt: 19 people were injured, police said.
ref: The governor's office said nineteen of the injured were police officers.

src: E whakapae ana ngā pirihimana ko te tangata tūkino he hōia Daesh (ISIL).
mt: Police say the suspect is a Daesh (ISIL) fighter.
ref: Police said they suspect an alleged Daesh (ISIL) militant of responsibility for the attack.

src: I kite ai rātou e ōrite ana ngā mātāpono o te Rā ki ētahi atu whetū: Nā te whērikoriko o ngā whetū katoa o te kāhui whetū, ō rātou huringa hoki.
mt: They noticed that the orbits of the planets were similar to those of other stars: Because of the precession of all the stars in the constellation, their retrograde motion.
ref: They found the Sun operated on the same basic principles as other stars: The activity of all stars in the system was found to be driven by their luminosity, their rotation, and nothing else.

src: Kei te whakamahia tahitia te kanapā me te huringa hei whakatau i te tau Rossby a tētahi tau, ā, e hāngai ana tērā ki te rere wētoto.
mt: The Rossby radius of deformation is used to determine the scale of the deformation, and this is related to the Coriolis force.
ref: The luminosity and rotation are used together to determine a star's Rossby number, which is related to plasma flow.

src: Te iti iho o te nama Rossby, ka ngoikore ake te whetū mō te āhuatanga ki te hurihanga aukume.
mt: The small Rossby radius, the planet's rotation causes the star to wobble.
ref: The smaller the Rossby number, the less active the star with respect to magnetic reversals.

src: I tana haerenga, he nui ngā wā i raru a Iwasaki.
mt: During his travels, Iwasaki faced many difficulties.
ref: During his trip, Iwasaki ran into trouble on many occasions.

src: I pāhua ia e ngā kaiā moana, i tukia ia i Tipete e tētahi kurī kua pāngia e te reipi, i pakiha ia i te mārenatanga i Nepōra, ā, i mauheretia ki Īnia.
mt: He was attacked by fishermen, thrown into the sea by a dog that had been hit by a car, and then rescued in Nepal and taken to India.
ref: He was robbed by pirates, attacked in Tibet by a rabid dog, escaped marriage in Nepal and was arrested in India.

src: Ko te paerewa 802.11n ka kōkiritia mā runga i te iarere 2.4Ghz me te 5.0Ghz
mt: 802.11n is based on the 2.4GHz and 5.0GHz bands
ref: The 802.11n standard operates on both the 2.4Ghz and 5.0Ghz frequencies.

src: Mā tēnei ka muri hototahi i te 802.11a, te 802.11b me te 802.11g, i runga i te āhuatanga e whai irirangi takirua ana te teihana.
mt: 802.11n is the latest in a series of wireless networking standards, following 802.11a, 802.11b and 802.11g, which all operate in the 2.4 GHz band.
ref: This will allow it to be backwards compatible with 802.11a, 802.11b and 802.11g, provided that the base station has dual radios.

src: Ko ngā tere o te 802.11n he tino tere ake i tērā o ngā mea o mua ko tā rātou putanga ariā nui rawa ko te 600Mbit/s.
mt: 802.11n speeds are much faster than previous standards, with a maximum theoretical throughput of 600Mbit/s.
ref: The speeds of 802.11n are substantially faster than that of its predecessors with a maximum theoretical throughput of 600Mbit/s.

src: Kāore a Duvall, kua mārenatia me ngā tamaiti pakeke e rua i waiho i tētahi whakaaro nui mō Miller, mō te take o tēnei kōrero.
mt: Duvall, who has two young children, said she was shocked by the news of Miller's death.
ref: Duvall, who is married with two adult children, did not leave a big impression on Miller, to whom the story was related.

src: Ka pātaia, ko tā Miller, "he ngutu hohoro a Mike i ngā wā o te whakawātanga... i te whakatika au i a au anō, kāore au i rongo i a ia.
mt: Miller said, "Mike's mouth was moving fast during the questioning... when I got up to him again, I didn't hear him."
ref: When asked for comment, Miller said, "Mike talks a lot during the hearing...I was getting ready so I wasn't really hearing what he was saying."

src: "Ka ngana tātou kia haukoti i te putanga waro hāora-rua ki ia waeine o te GDP ki tētahi rahinga nui, i mua i te tau 2020 mai i te taumata o te tau 2005," te kī a Hu.
mt: "We want to achieve a growth rate of 8 percent per year in GDP to a significant level before 2020 from the level of 2005," Hu said.
ref: "We will endeavour to cut carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP by a notable margin by 2020 from the 2005 level," Hu said.

src: Kāore ia i whakarite i ētahi nama mō ngā tapatapahi, e kī ana ka whakaritea i runga i te tāputa o te ohaoha o Haina.
mt: He did not name the victims, saying they would be identified later by the Chinese embassy.
ref: He did not set a figure for the cuts, saying they will be made based on China's economic output.

src: I akiaki a Hu i ngā whenua e whanake ana "kia āraia te huarahi o mua o te parakino i te tuatahi, me te whakapai i muri iho ."
mt: Hu encouraged the countries to "pave the way for the first time, and then improve later."
ref: Hu encouraged developing countries "to avoid the old path of polluting first and cleaning up later."

src: Nāna i tāpiri "heoi anō, me kaua rātou e tonoa kia hiki i ngā kawenga kei tua atu i tā rātou wā whakawhanaketanga, haepapa, āheinga hoki."
mt: "However, they should not be deployed until they have been fully tested, evaluated and certified."
ref: He added that "they should not, however, be asked to take on obligations that go beyond their development stage, responsibility and capabilities."

src: I tukuna e te Iraq Study Group tāna pūrongo i te 12.00 GMT i tēnei rā.
mt: The Iraq Study Group released its report at 12:00 GMT today.
ref: The Iraq Study Group presented its report at 12.00 GMT today.

src: He whakatūpato, kāore tētahi e āhei te kī ake mā tētahi mahinga ahakoa te aha e whakatū i te whawhai whakahāweatanga, i ngā kinonga e tupu tonu ana, i te tutūnga o te pūehu rānei ki Irāki.
mt: A statement, no one can say that the bombing of the ongoing conflict, the growth of the insurgency or the presence of the U.S. military in Iraq.
ref: It warns No one can guarantee that any course of action in Iraq at this point will stop sectarian warfare, growing violence, or a slide toward chaos.

src: Ka tīmata te Rīpoata ki te inoi mō tētahi tautohetohe tūmatawhānui me te whakaritenga o tētahi whakaaetanga ki Ngā Whenua Tōpū o Amerika mō te kaupapa here ki te Waenga o te Rāwhiti.
mt: The report will begin with a request for a comprehensive review and a plan for implementing an agreement with the United States on the issue of the Pacific Ocean.
ref: The Report opens with plea for open debate and the formation of a consensus in the United States about the policy towards the Middle East.

src: E aro nui ana te rīpoata ki ngā āhuatanga katoa kei te kaupapa here mō te kāhui whakahaere ki a Irāki, ā, e whakatenatena hoki i tētahi tirohanga hou.
mt: The report focuses on all aspects of the ongoing operation in Iraq, and also provides a new perspective.
ref: The Report is highly critical of almost every aspect of the present policy of the Executive towards Iraq and it urges an immediate change of direction.

src: Ko te tuatahi o ngā kupu taunaki e 78 kia puta he kaupapa hou i mua i te paunga o tēnei tau e tau ai ngā roherohenga whenua o Īraki hei ārai atu i te hunga urutomo mai, me te whakatū mai anō i ngā hononga i waenganui i ngā hoa piripono.
mt: 78 words of new legislation will be introduced before the end of this year to regulate foreign land ownership, and to strengthen ties between friends and family.
ref: First among its 78 recommendations is that a new diplomatic initiative should be taken before the end of this year to secure Iraq’s borders against hostile interventions and to re-establish diplomatic relations with its neighbors.

src: I te pō ō nanahi nei whakatauria ai e te kainganga ture ō nāianei, te Māreikura hoki o Argentina, a First Lady Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner ōna tūmanakotanga mō te perehitini ki La Plata, he taone 50 kiromita (31 maero) nei te tawhiti atu i Buenos Aires.
mt: 50 kilometers (31 miles) away from Buenos Aires, the First Lady of Argentina, Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner, was expected to attend a rally in La Plata.
ref: Current senator and Argentine First Lady Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner announced her presidential candidacy yesterday evening in La Plata, a city 50 kilometers (31 miles) away from Buenos Aires.

src: I whakapuaki a Mrs. Kirchner i tana takune ki te tono i te tūranga perehitene ki te Argentine Theatre, arā ko te wāhi i whakamahia e ia hei tīmata i tana tautohe i te tau 2005 mō te Senate hei mema o te apatono ā-takiwā o Buenos Aires.
mt: Mrs. Kirchner announced her candidacy for the Argentine Theatre, the place where she began her campaign in 2005 for the Senate as a member of the provincial legislature of Buenos Aires.
ref: Mrs. Kirchner announced her intention to run for president at the Argentine Theatre, the same location she used to start her 2005 campaign for the Senate as member of the Buenos Aires province delegation.

src: I whakakāngia te tautohe e te whawhai mō te utu ki te whakamāmā me te hanganga anō whai muri i Hurricane Katrina; arā he whakatoi te tapa a ētahi ringa poto i tērā hei "Bush's New Orleans Deal."
mt: The lawsuit alleges fraud and negligence in the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina; that is, some small hands were "Bush's New Orleans Deal."
ref: The debate was sparked by controversy over spending on relief and reconstruction in the wake Hurricane Katrina; which some fiscal conservatives have humorously labeled "Bush's New Orleans Deal."

src: Kua aro atu ngā kōrero whakahē huhua o te mahi hanga anō ki te tuku i ngā kirimana hanga anō ki te hunga e whakaarohia ana he hoa nō roto o Washington.
mt: Numerous reports of the work being done to send the letters to the recipients of the letters.
ref: Liberal criticism of the reconstruction effort has focused on the awarding of reconstruction contracts to perceived Washington insiders.

src: Neke atu i te whā miriona tāngata i haere ki Rōma hei tae atu ki te tangi.
mt: 4 million people are expected to attend the funeral.
ref: Over four million people went to Rome to attend the funeral.

src: I pērā rawa te tini o ngā tāngata i tae mai kāore i taea e te katoa te tangihanga nei ki St. Pita Tapawhā te tomo.
mt: The large number of people who came to the funeral of St. Pita Tapawhā could not all fit into the church.
ref: The number of people present was so large that it was not possible for everybody to gain access to the funeral in St. Peter's Square.

src: Ka whakatūria ētahi mata pouaka whakaata rahi ki ētahi wāhi ki Rōma kia āhei te tangata te mātakitaki i te hui.
mt: Some large video screens will be erected in some areas of Rome to allow people to watch the event.
ref: Several large television screens were installed in various places in Rome to let the people watch the ceremony.

src: Ki ngā tāone nui kē atu o Itari, ki te toenga o te ao anō hoki, inarā ki Pōrana, i whakaritea pēnei hoki ngā hanganga, ā, i mātakitakihia e te tini o ngā tāngata.
mt: In other major cities around the world, including Paris, similar protests were planned, and many people attended.
ref: In many other cities of Italy and in the rest of the world, particularly in Poland, similar setups were made, which were viewed by a great number of people.

src: Kua whakakoha ngā tumu kōrero i ngā kaupapa here o mua o te FBI mō te tuku i ngā rawa ki ngā kēhi he māmā te whakaoti, inarā ko ngā kēhi waka tāhae, me te whāinga o te whakahiki i te pāpātanga angitu o te umanga.
mt: The FBI has released documents on the agency's efforts to secure the evidence, including the search of the plane, and the attempt to prevent the destruction of the business.
ref: Historians have criticized past FBI policies for focusing resources on cases which are easy to solve, especially stolen car cases, with the intent of boosting the agency's success rate.

src: I tīmata te Kaunihera ki te tautoko ā-pūtea i te kaupapa kerekere i te tau 2005, me te whakatau hoki me rohea kia 10 ngā apataki mai i te FBI ki ngā kiriata pakeke.
mt: 2005, the Council began supporting the program with funding and agreed to increase the number of agents from the FBI to 10 films.
ref: Congress began funding the obscenity initiative in fiscal 2005 and specified that the FBI must devote 10 agents to adult pornography.

src: I eke a Robin Uthappa ki ngā piro nui rawa o te wāhanga, arā ko ngā omanga 70 ki te 41 pōro noa iho mā te hau i ngā whā 11, i ngā ono e 2.
mt: 70-year-old Robin Uthappa scored the highest number of runs in the innings, 70 not out in 11 overs, 2 sixes.
ref: Robin Uthappa made the innings highest score, 70 runs in just 41 balls by hitting 11 fours and 2 sixes.

src: I tino pai te tākaro a ngā kaipatu pōro ō waenganui, a Sachin Tendulkar rāua ko Rahul David, ā, kotahi rau ā rāua piro.
mt: 10 wickets fell in the middle overs, with Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul David taking 4 each.
ref: Middle order batsmen, Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid, performed well and made a hundred-run partnership.

src: Heoi anō, whai muri i te ngaronga o tā te kāpene wīkiti i riro noa i a Īnia te 36 omanga me te hinganga o te 7 wīkiti hei whakaoti i te huinga.
mt: 36 people were killed and 7 were injured in the end of the group.
ref: But, after losing the captain's wicket India only made 36 runs loosing 7 wickets to end the innings.

src: I tae atu a President George W. Bush o Ngā Whenua Tōpū o Amerika ki Hingapoa i te ata o te rā 6 o Noema, i reira i tīmata tētahi haerenga kotahi wiki te roa o Āhia.
mt: 6 November, President George W. Bush of the United States arrived in India, where he began a one-week tour of Asia.
ref: U.S. President George W. Bush arrived in Singapore the morning of November 16, beginning a week-long tour of Asia.

src: I mihia ia e te Pirimia Tuarua o Hingapoa a Wong Kan Seng, ā, i wānanga i te hokohoko me ngā take whakatuatea ki te Pirimia o Hingapoa a Lee Hsien Loong.
mt: He was greeted by Singapore's Deputy Prime Minister Wong Kan Seng, and discussed trade and other issues with Singapore's Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong.
ref: He was greeted by Singapore's Deputy Prime Minister Wong Kan Seng and discussed trade and terrorism issues with the Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong.

src: Whai muri i te kotahi wiki o ngā hinganga ki te kōwhiringa pōti waenga wā, nā Bush i whaki atu ki tētahi minenga mō te whakawhānuitanga o te hokohoko ki Āhia.
mt: 1 week after the election, Bush met with a group of business leaders to discuss trade with Asia.
ref: After a week of losses in the midterm election, Bush told an audience about the expansion of trade in Asia.

src: Kua whakaae te Pirimia a Stephen Harper ki te tuku i te "Clean Air Act" o te kāwanatanga ki tētahi komiti pāti-katoa hei arotake, i mua i tana pānuitanga tuarua, ā muri i te hui 25 meneti te roa i te Tūrei ki te kaiārahi NPD a Jack Layton ki te PMO.
mt: Prime Minister Stephen Harper agreed to the "Clean Air Act" of the government to a committee of all parties for review, before his second reading, after a 25-minute meeting with NDP leader Jack Layton to the PMO.
ref: Prime Minister Stephen Harper has agreed to send the government's 'Clean Air Act' to an all-party committee for review, before its second reading, after Tuesday's 25 minute meeting with NDP leader Jack Layton at the PMO.

src: Kua tono a Layton ki ngā panoni ki te pire taiao o ngā conservatives i te hui ki te Pirimia, i te tono ki tētahi "tuhinga anō he ngaio, he tukupū" o te piri taiao o te pāti Conservative.
mt: Layton has asked the Conservatives to sign a "stronger and more binding" climate change policy at a meeting with the Prime Minister.
ref: Layton had asked for changes to the conservatives' environmental bill during the meeting with the PM, asking for a "thorough and complete rewriting" of the Conservative party's environmental bill.

src: Mai rā anō i te tūnga mai o te Kāwanatanga Aka Haumi ki te whakahaere i ngā pūtea o te hōhipera Mersey ki Devonport, Tasmania, kua whakahēngia tēnei mahi e te kāwanatanga ā-motu, e ētahi Mema Pāremata aka haumi hei whakangaio i te aranga atu ki te pōtitanga aka haumi me karanga ā te marama o Noema, ā mua rānei.
mt: The federal government has rejected the proposal to privatize the Mersey Hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, with some members of the opposition party calling for an early election in November.
ref: Ever since the Federal Government stepped in to take over funding of the Mersey hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, the state government and some federal MPs have criticised this act as a stunt in the prelude to the federal election to be called by November.

src: Engari, hei tā te Pirimia, tā John Howard, ko te kaupapa o te pire he manaaki i ngā hohipera kia kore ai ō rātou mana e takahia e te Kāwanatanga o Tāhimana, ka whakawhiwhia ki te AUD$45 miriona.
mt: However, as Prime Minister John Howard said, the purpose of the bribe is to protect the pirates from the government of Somalia, which will be awarded AUD$45 million.
ref: But Prime Minister John Howard has said the act was only to safeguard the facilities of the hospital from being downgraded by the Tasmanian government, in giving an extra AUD$45 million.

src: E ai ki te pānui hou, ko ngā karere e kī ana mō te pikinga o te moana i rewa ake tētahi tsunami. I rikoata tika i te mahinga tsunami pā tata atu ki pago pago me Niue.
mt: A new report says the tsunami warning was issued after a tsunami wave was detected in the area near Tonga and Niue.
ref: According to the latest bulletin, sea level readings indicated a tsunami was generated. There was some definite tsunami activity recorded near Pago Pago and Niue.

src: Kāore he kinonga nui, he whara rānei i rīpoatangia ki Tonga, heoi i ngaro te hiko, ā, nā tenei i ngaro hoki te kaha kia rongo ai i te ohoreretanga mai i te PTWC e pā ana ki te tsunami.
mt: There was no major damage or injuries reported in Tonga, but the island was cut off from the rest of the world, and this also cut off the ability to hear the PTWC's warning about the tsunami.
ref: No major damage or injuries have been reported in Tonga, but power was temporarily lost, which reportedly prevented Tongan authorities from receiving the tsunami warning issued by the PTWC.

src: I katia ngā kura tata ki te takutai moana tekau mā whā mō te katoa o te Wenerei, he aha koa te hikitanga o ngā whakatūpato.
mt: 24 hours of rain for the entire week, what a great success.
ref: Fourteen schools in Hawaii located on or near coastlines were closed all of Wednesday despite the warnings being lifted.

src: I rāhiri te Perehitene o Ngā Whenua Tōpū o Amerika a George W. Bush i te puakitanga.
mt: President of the United States of America George W. Bush attended the ceremony.
ref: U.S. President George W. Bush welcomed the announcement.

src: Mō te āhua ki a Korea ki te Raki, ka kī ake te māngai a Bush, ko Gordon Johndroe, "he āhuatanga nui tēnei ki te whakatutuki i te whakatūturutanga o te pāpurupuru-kore ki runga o te kūrae o Korea.
mt: In a statement to reporters in Seoul, White House spokesman Gordon Johndroe said, "This is a significant step toward the complete denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula."
ref: Bush spokesman Gordon Johndroe called North Korea's pledge "a major step towards the goal of achieving the verifiable denuclearization of the Korean peninsula."

src: Ko te ingoa o te āwha tuangāhuru ki te whai ingoa o te kaupeka haumātakataka o Atlantic, arā ko Subtropical Storm Jerry, i rewa ake ki te Atlantic Ocean i te rā nei.
mt: The name of the October hurricane in the Atlantic is subtropical storm Jerry, which formed in the Atlantic Ocean today.
ref: The tenth named storm of the Atlantic Hurricane season, Subtropical Storm Jerry, formed in the Atlantic Ocean today.

src: E kī ana te National Hurricane Center (NHC) i tēnei wā kāore he whakatuma tō Jerry ki te whenua.
mt: The National Hurricane Center (NHC) says Jerry is not expected to make landfall.
ref: The National Hurricane Center (NHC) says that at this point Jerry poses no threat to land.

src: Kei te whakatau tata ngā U.S. Corps of Engineers ko te 6 īnihi o te hekenga ua ka wāwāhi pea i ngā maioro kua pakaru kē.
mt: 6 hours after the storm surge, the U.S. Corps of Engineers said the levees had been breached.
ref: The U.S. Corps of Engineers estimated that 6 inches of rainfall could breach the previously damaged levees.

src: Ko te Ninth Ward, i reira i waipuketia tae atu ki te 20 putu te teitei i te wā o Hurricane Katrina, kei te noho ki raro i te wai he hope te teitei i te ekenga o te maioro oneone tata.
mt: 20 feet of the Ninth Ward, which was flooded up to 20 feet during Hurricane Katrina, is now below sea level due to land subsidence.
ref: The Ninth Ward, which saw flooding as high as 20 feet during Hurricane Katrina, is currently in waist-high water as the nearby levee was overtopped.

src: Kei te maringi te wai i te maioro ki tētahi wāhanga e 100 putu te whānui.
mt: 100 meters of the road was flooded.
ref: Water is spilling over the levee in a section 100 feet wide.

src: Nā te Commons Administrator a Adam Cuerden i whakapuaki i tōna hōhā mō ngā whakakorenga i tana kōrero atu ki Wikinews i tērā marama.
mt: Commons Administrator Adam Cuerden has expressed his frustration over the deletion of his Wikinews article this month.
ref: Commons Administrator Adam Cuerden expressed his frustration over the deletions when he spoke to Wikinews last month.

src: "I rūkahu noa ia [a Wales] ki a mātou mai i te tīmatanga. Tuatahi, nā te mahi anō nei he take ā-ture mō tēnei. Tuarua, nā te whakaata i tāna whakarongo mai ki a mātou, tae noa atu ki te whakakorenga o āna toi."
mt: "He was very upset with us from the beginning. First, it was the fact that we were there. Second, it was the fact that he was listening to us, and finally, it was the fact that he was cutting his hair."
ref: "He [Wales] basically lied to us from the start. First, by acting as if this was for legal reasons. Second, by pretending he was listening to us, right up to his art deletion."

src: Nā te hīrawerawe ā-hapori ngā mahi o nāianei hei tuhi hukihuki i tētahi kaupapa here e pā ana ki ngā kiko onioni mō te pae tukutuku kei reira ngā tini miriona pāpaho raihana-tuwhera.
mt: 21st century social media has made it easy to spread a false story about onions on the internet, where millions of people can read it.
ref: The community irritation led to current efforts to draft a policy regarding sexual content for the site which hosts millions of openly-licensed media.

src: Ko te nuinga o ngā mahi i oti he mahi ariā, engari kua tuhia te hōtaka kia whakarite ki ngā tironga o te ikarangi o Sagittarius.
mt: 99% of the work is done, but the schedule has been revised to accommodate the Sagittarius A* radio source.
ref: The work done was mostly theoretical, but the program was written to simulate observations made of the Sagittarius galaxy.

src: Ko te hua e rapua ana i te tīma ko tētahi ka rewangia ake e ngā ngarungaru kaha i waenga i te pō uriuri o te ikarangi me te pō tangotango o te mangōroa.
mt: The cause of the crash is being investigated by the powerful military police.
ref: The effect the team was looking for would be caused by tidal forces between the galaxy's dark matter and the Milky Way's dark matter.

src: Pērā i te tō mai a te marama ki te ao, me tāna whakarite i ngā tai, ka pērā hoki te tuku tōpana a te Te Ika-whenua-o-te-rangi ki te ikarangi Sagittarius.
mt: As the moon waxes in the sky, so too does it set the tides, so too does the Earth's rotation set the Sagittarius Arm.
ref: Just like the moon exerts a pull on the earth, causing tides, so does the Milky Way exert a force on the Sagittarius galaxy.

src: I taea e ngā kaiputaiao te whakatau, ko te mea pouri ka pā e ētahi atu mea pouri i te āhuatanga ōrite ki te mea noa nei.
mt: The researchers were able to sort, with the same accuracy as the current method.
ref: The scientists were able to conclude that the dark matter affect other dark matter in the same way regular matter does.

src: E mea ana tēnei ariā ko te pōuriuri mei te ao tukupū
mt: This article is about the current state of the economy
ref: This theory says that most dark matter around a galaxy is located around a galaxy in a kind of halo, and is made of lots of small particles.

src: E whakaatu ana ngā pāhotanga pouaka whakaata i te auahi mā e puta ana i te hanganga.
mt: The fire department said the fire was caused by the explosion.
ref: Television reports show white smoke coming from the plant.

src: E whakahau ana ngā mana-ā-rohe o te takiwa o te hanganga kia noho iho ki rō whare, kia whakaweto i ngā whāhauhau, kia kauaka te wai o te kōrere e inungia.
mt: Authorities in the affected area are advising residents to stay indoors, turn off fans and close windows to prevent water from entering.
ref: Local authorities are warning residents in the vicinity of the plant to stay indoors, turn off air-conditioners and not to drink tap water.

src: E ai ki te tari karihi a Hapani, kua kitea te cesium irirangi me te iodine e tupu ana i te wāhi mahi.
mt: The Japanese Nuclear and Industrial Safety Agency said it has detected cesium and iodine in the air.
ref: According to Japan's nuclear agency, radioactive caesium and iodine has been identified at the plant.

src: Kei te whakapae ngā mana he tohu tēnei i whakapakaru pea ngā ipu o te kora konukarihi ki te wāhi, ā, kei te komama.
mt: Authorities say this may indicate the fuel tanks were breached, and the fire is still burning.
ref: Authorities speculate that this indicates that containers holding uranium fuel at the site may have ruptured and are leaking.

src: I kitea e Tākuta tony Moll i te Taru Ārai Nui mō te Tuberculosis (XDR-TB) ki te rohe o Awhiriki ki te Tonga, ki te rohe o KwaZulu i Natal.
mt: 2006, Dr. Tony Moll discovered XDR-TB in the Eastern Cape, South Africa, KwaZulu Natal.
ref: Dr. Tony Moll discovered the Extremely Drug Resistant Tuberculosis (XDR-TB) in the South African region KwaZulu-Natal.

src: I roto i tetahi uiui, ka kī ia ko te rerenga hou he "nui te tupono he mea whakararu, he mea pāwera i runga i te pāpātanga hemo tino teitei."
mt: In a statement, he said the new runway was "too short, too steep and too close to the sea."
ref: In an interview, he said the new variant was "very highly troubling and alarming because of the very high fatality rate."

src: Kua pāngia ētahi tūroro e te ngārara ki te hohipera, te whakaaro a Dr. Moll, ā, tokorua i te itinga iho he kaimahi hauora hohipera.
mt: 2 health workers were bitten by a rabid dog, according to Dr. Moll.
ref: Some patients might have contracted the bug in the hospital, Dr. Moll thinks, and at least two were hospital health workers.
